messages.subject: Jumping from one movie to another (was Speaking of Musicals)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/19/04 8:46:45 AM, piscesmomx3@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/19/04 8:46:45 AM, piscesmomx3@... writes:

<< Most of the ones I would say have already been suggested, but I haven't
noticed Camelot yet. My 6 yro and 4 yro loved the Richard Harris musical. >>

Some kids who might otherwise have bypassed it, too, might find greater
interest because of his having played Dumbledore.

Henry V (without even being a musical!) got another pass here after the
second Harry Potter movie was out, so they could see Kenneth Brannagh, and there's
Bilbo, being Flewellyn (Ian Holm).

Brian Blessed's in it too, who's also in Man of La Mancha, and some of the
Black Adder episodes.

Robbie Coltrane's there, who's Hagrid, and also the Ghost (combo ghosts) on
Black Adder's Christmas Carol.

Those were pretty good connect-the-dots bits for my kids!
